message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $90.
I'm interested in the product, but I think it's a bit pricey. I'm willing to pay $85 for it.
I understand you think it's pricey, but I think it's worth more than that. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $92.50.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me in the middle, but I'm still a bit hesitant. I'm willing to pay $87.50 for the product.
I'm not willing to go as low as $87.50, but I'm willing to make a compromise. I can meet you at $92, but that's as low as I can go.
I'm still not comfortable with $92. I'm willing to pay $89 for the product.
I'm getting close to my minimum price, but I still think the product is worth more to you than $89. I'm willing to meet you at $91, but that's as low as I can go.
I'm still not comfortable with $91. I'm willing to pay $88.50 for the product.
I'm not willing to go any lower than $90. I'm starting to think we're not going to meet in the middle. I'll give you one last chance to meet me at $90, but that's it.
I'm sorry, but I've reached my limit. I'm not willing to pay $90. I think I'll have to look elsewhere for the product.
